title.narrative: Suivi des progrès, écarts et innovations pour améliorer le programme GESS
Tracking Progress, Deviations, and Innovations to Improve GEHS Programming

description.narrative:
IDRC's Governance for Equity in Health Systems (GEHS) program must track its progress toward its goal of enhancing its contribution to building equitable health systems in developing countries. This project will allow the program to assess progress on its four program-level outcomes: -form a critical mass of researchers and institutions in low- and middle-income countries -develop a knowledge base on innovative and rigorous research methodologies -generate a body of knowledge and evidence -influence policies, practices, agendas, and funding priorities to strengthen health systems
Improved programming, stronger health systems As the program builds its portfolio of projects in low- and middle-income countries, it is important to examine the evolving programming strategy and approach.
Taking a learning-based approach to program development can ensure that -activities contribute to achieving desired outcomes -adjustments to programming are made as needed -decisions are taken strategically
GEHS has developed a three-pronged approach to tracking progress: -quantitative analysis of graduated indicators -qualitative analysis of project trajectories -learning from partners' critical feedback
Monitoring and evaluation This project will provide funds to hold workshops and activities that will contribute to GEHS' monitoring and evaluation strategy, including the hiring of external evaluators.
